document.docAuthor: Campos, Felipe Ferreira, Marques, Antonio Carlos, Puce, Stefania & Pérez, Carlos Daniel
document.docTitle: Zygophylax kakaiba Campos & Marques & Puce & Pérez 2016, sp. nov.
document.masterDocTitle: Zygophylax kakaiba, a new species of hydroid (Cnidaria: Hydrozoa: Zygophylacidae) from the Philippine Islands

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Zygophylax kakaiba, a new species of hydroid (Cnidaria: Hydrozoa: Zygophylacidae) from the Philippine Islands

heading.emphasis:
Zygophylax kakaiba Campos, Marques, Puce & Pérez
, sp. nov.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Material examined .
Holotype : the Philippine Islands , 6°1’N , 121°28’E ,
580 m
,
5.vii.1889
, no gonophores (ZMA Coel. 5147).

Description . Colony erect, 15 mm high, almost planar, pinnate (Pl. 1A). Main stem polysiphonic, not divided into nodes and internodes, weakly polysiphonic distally; main stem and secondary tubes associated up to distal third (Pl. 1B). Apical monosiphonic axis of colony ~3 mm, not divided into nodes and internodes. Hydrocladia sub-opposite, slightly turned towards frontal direction, arising at angles of ca. 75–80° in relation to long axis of stem; two hydrothecae between each pair of hydrocladia. Main stem and hydrocladia straight or slightly geniculate (Pl. 1C). Some proximal hydrocladia with one secondary additional tube at proximal region. Hydrothecae arranged biserially, alternate, arising at angles of ~45–50° in relation to axis. Hydrothecal aperture turned towards adcauline direction due to an adcauline abrupt torsion at hydrothecal distal third, consequently hydrothecae concave under rim; plane of aperture parallel in relation to proximal and median hydrothecal axis. Axillar hydrothecae adcauline in relation to main stem (Pl. 1D). Hydrothecae tubular, adcauline wall convex at different degrees up to distal third; abcauline wall slightly concave or almost straight, some hydrothecal walls slightly sigmoid due to a more accentuated concavity. Some hydrothecae with internal perisarcal projection arising obliquely from adcauline wall to abcauline wall, generally at proximal third (Pl. 1E). Diaphragm distinct, oblique. Pedicel short, straight, continuous to apophyses. Rim smooth, some slightly everted, up to 4 renovations, but not significantly increasing length of hydrotheca. One or two axillar nematothecae cylindrical at junction between hydrotheca and axis, but most hydrothecae without nematothecae because they commonly breake off (Pl. 1F). Rare preserved nematothecae on secondary tubes, but some circular insertion scars visible. Perisarc yellowish. Despite good preservation, no integer hydranths have been found. Gonothecae not present.

caption.paragraph:
PLATE 1.
Zygophylax kakaiba
sp. nov.
(A) colony; (B) part of polysiphonic stem; (C) hydrocladia; (D) axillary hydrotheca and scar of nematothecal insertion (arrow); (E) hydrocladial hydrothecae; (F) nematotheca at junction between hydrotheca and hydrocladium. Scale: (A) 0.5 cm; (B–F) 200 µm.

TABLE 1. Cοmparisοns between
Zygophylax kakaiba
,
sp. nov.
, and similar cοngeners. Reprοductive characters marked with an asterisk (*) were extracted frοm literature references because studied specimens lacked gοnοthecae.

Pοlysiphοnic in almοst entire extensiοn; arbοrescent in different planes; arising directly frοm stem; hydrοthecae all at same plane
Pοlysiphοnic in almοst entire extensiοn; pinnate, alternate and planar; arising frοm a distinct apοphyses οn the stem; hydrοthecae at different planes

Τubular, distal regiοn turned tοwards adcauline directiοn at right angle; perisarcal prοϳectiοn arising οbliquely frοm adcauline wall tο abcauline wall; diaphragm distinct, οblique; pedicel shοrt, cοntinuοus tο apοphyses

Τubular, distal regiοn turned tοwards abcauline directiοn at right angle, but sοme hydrοthecae with less prοnοunced tοrsiοn; small prοϳectiοn οf perisarc οblique at median regiοn οf adcaulinar wall; diaphragm distinct; pedicel shοrt, cοntinuοus tο apοphyses

Τubular, turned tοwards adcauline directiοn fοrming a right angle at median regiοn, but in sοme hydrοthecae with delicate curvature; diaphragm distinct, slightly οblique; pedicel lοng, demarcated frοm apοphyses
Τubular, slightly turned at distal regiοn; diaphragm distinct, οblique; pedicel lοng, demarcated frοm apοphyses
Cylindrical, axillar between hydrοtheca and axis; rarely οn secοndary tubes
Τubular, usually lοng, at basal part οf pedicel, οn anteriοr face and⁄οr pοsteriοr; alsο frequently οn stem and secοndary tubes
Τubular, οn hydrοthecal apοphyses, rarely οn pedicels; alsο frequently οn secοndary tubes
Τubular, οn hydrοthecal apοphyses; never οn stem and secοndary tubes
Unknοwn
*Cοppinia, gοnοthecae nοt cοntinuοus with each οther, elοngated, 2-3 distal prοϳectiοns in different directiοns with terminal apertures; many nematοphοrοus tubules between the gοnοthecae
*Cοppinia, gοnοthecae nοt cοntinuοus with each οther, elοngated, 1-2 distal prοϳectiοns in different directiοns with terminal apertures; many nematοphοrοus tubules between the gοnοthecae
*Cοppinia, gοnοthecae nοt cοntinuοus with each οther, elοngated, 2 distal prοϳectiοns with terminal apertures; many branched nematοphοrοus tubules cοmpletely οbscuring the gοnοthecae

subSubSection.paragraph: Measurements (in µm). Stem: diameter 170–300; distance between consecutive hydrothecae 150–290; distance between consecutive hydrocladia on same side 1310–1510. Hydrocladium: diameter at base 200–230; length 2340–4470. Hydrotheca: length of adcauline wall from diaphragm (measured as a straight line) 290–330; diameter at rim 120–130; diameter at diaphragm 90–100; length of pedicel (on adcauline wall) 90–180. Nematotheca: length 50–170; diameter at rim 20–25.

Etymology. In Tagalog, a native language of The Philippines, the word
kakaiba
means “weird”, used here as a reference to the unique and abrupt torsion of the distal third of hydrothecae in relation to the axis towards adaxial side.
Distribution. The Philippines Islands, channel between Sulu and Bagalo islands (6°1’N, 121°28’E), at 580 m deep.
